Container.Name: AnythingLLM-PG
Container.Overview: AnythingLLM is a full-stack application that you can run locally on your desktop or on a server. It allows you to turn any document, resource, or piece of content into data that a Large Language Model (LLM) can use as a reference for responses. This version is configured to use an external PostgreSQL database with PGVector support.
Container.Description:
AnythingLLM is a full-stack application that you can run locally on your desktop or on a server. It allows you to turn any document, resource, or piece of content into data that a Large Language Model (LLM) can use as a reference for responses. This version is configured to use an external PostgreSQL database with PGVector support.
You MUST have a PostgreSQL server running with the pgvector extension enabled.

Config.Name: Web UI Port
Config.Description: Port for accessing the AnythingLLM Web UI.

Config.Name: Storage Path
Config.Description: Path for AnythingLLM to store its data (vector caches, etc.).

Config.Name: Env File Path
Config.Description: Path to the .env file. Create this file to set additional environment variables.

Config.Name: Database URL
Config.Description: The connection URL for your PostgreSQL database. Ensure the user and database exist and the pgvector extension is enabled.
